intro: Funastrum gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's funastrum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Funastrum gardneri is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to moist, well-drained soils.
